charts.Charts.name: Charts
charts.Charts.doc: Entry point for creating Charts in scripts.

property.name: ChartHiddenDimensionStrategy
property.doc: An enumeration of how hidden dimensions in a source are expressed in a chart.

property.name: ChartMergeStrategy
property.doc: An enumeration of how multiple ranges in the source are expressed in a chart.

property.name: ChartType
property.doc: An enumeration of chart types supported by the Charts service.

property.name: ColumnType
property.doc: An enumeration of the valid data types for columns in a DataTable.

property.name: CurveStyle
property.doc: An enumeration of the styles for curves in a chart.

property.name: MatchType
property.doc: An enumeration of how a string value should be matched.

property.name: Orientation
property.doc: An enumeration of the orientation of an object.

property.name: PickerValuesLayout
property.doc: An enumeration of how to display selected values in a picker widget.

property.name: PointStyle
property.doc: An enumeration of the styles of points in a line.

property.name: Position
property.doc: An enumeration of legend positions within a chart.

method.name: newAreaChart
method.doc: Starts building an area chart, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newBarChart
method.doc: Starts building a bar chart, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newCategoryFilter
method.doc: Starts building a category filter control, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newColumnChart
method.doc: Starts building a column chart, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newDashboardPanel
method.doc: Starts building a dashboard panel, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newDataTable
method.doc: Creates an empty data table, which can have its values set manually.

method.name: newDataViewDefinition
method.doc: Creates a new data view definition.

method.name: newLineChart
method.doc: Starts building a line chart, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newNumberRangeFilter
method.doc: Starts building a number range filter control, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newPieChart
method.doc: Starts building a pie chart, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newScatterChart
method.doc: Starts building a scatter chart, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newStringFilter
method.doc: Starts building a string filter control, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newTableChart
method.doc: Starts building a table chart, as described in the Google Chart Tools documentation.

method.name: newTextStyle
method.doc: Creates a new text style builder.

charts.AreaChartBuilder.name: AreaChartBuilder
charts.AreaChartBuilder.doc: Builder for area charts. For more details, see the Google Charts documentation.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds the chart.

method.name: reverseCategories
method.doc: Reverses the drawing of series in the domain axis.

method.name: setBackgroundColor
method.doc: Sets the background color for the chart.

argument.name: cssValue
argument.doc: the CSS value for the color (such as "blue" or "#00f")

method.name: setColors
method.doc: Sets the colors for the lines in the chart.

argument.name: cssValues
argument.doc: an array of color CSS values, such as ["red", "#acf"]. The nth element in the array represents the color of the nth line in the chart.

method.name: setDataSourceUrl
method.doc: Sets the data source URL that will be used to pull data in from an external source, such as Google Sheets.

argument.name: url
argument.doc: the data source URL, including any query parameters

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table to use for the chart using a DataTableBuilder.

argument.name: tableBuilder
argument.doc: a data table builder. A new data table will be created instantly as part of this call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the chart.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table which contains the lines for the chart, as well as the X-axis labels.

argument.name: table
argument.doc: the data table to use for the chart

method.name: setDataViewDefinition
method.doc: Sets the data view definition to use for the chart.

argument.name: dataViewDefinition
argument.doc: a data view definition object that defines the view that should be derived from the given data source for the chart drawing

method.name: setDimensions
method.doc: Sets the dimensions for the chart.

argument.name: width
argument.doc: the width of the chart, in pixels

argument.name: height
argument.doc: the height of the chart, in pixels

method.name: setLegendPosition
method.doc: Sets the position of the legend with respect to the chart.

argument.name: position
argument.doc: the position of the legend

method.name: setLegendTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the text style of the chart legend.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the chart legend.

method.name: setOption
method.doc: Sets advanced options for this chart.

argument.name: option
argument.doc: the option to set

argument.name: value
argument.doc: the value to set

method.name: setPointStyle
method.doc: Sets the style for points in the line.

argument.name: style
argument.doc: the style to use for points in the line

method.name: setRange
method.doc: Sets the range for the chart.

argument.name: start
argument.doc: value for the lowest grid line of the range axis

argument.name: end
argument.doc: value for the highest grid line of the range axis

method.name: setStacked
method.doc: Uses stacked lines, meaning that line and bar values are stacked (accumulated).

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the title of the chart.

argument.name: chartTitle
argument.doc: the chart title.

method.name: setTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the text style of the chart title.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the chart title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setXAxisTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the horizontal axis text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setXAxisTitle
method.doc: Adds a title to the horizontal axis.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title for the X-axis

method.name: setXAxisTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the horizontal axis title text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setYAxisTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the vertical axis text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setYAxisTitle
method.doc: Adds a title to the vertical axis.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title for the Y-axis

method.name: setYAxisTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the vertical axis title text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: useLogScale
method.doc: Makes the range axis into a logarithmic scale (requires all values to be positive).

charts.BarChartBuilder.name: BarChartBuilder
charts.BarChartBuilder.doc: Builder for bar charts. For more details, see the Google Charts documentation.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds the chart.

method.name: reverseCategories
method.doc: Reverses the drawing of series in the domain axis.

method.name: reverseDirection
method.doc: Reverses the direction in which the bars grow along the horizontal axis.

method.name: setBackgroundColor
method.doc: Sets the background color for the chart.

argument.name: cssValue
argument.doc: the CSS value for the color (such as "blue" or "#00f")

method.name: setColors
method.doc: Sets the colors for the lines in the chart.

argument.name: cssValues
argument.doc: an array of color CSS values, such as ["red", "#acf"]. The nth element in the array represents the color of the nth line in the chart.

argument.name: url

argument.name: tableBuilder
argument.doc: a data table builder. A new data table will be created instantly as part of this call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the chart.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table which contains the lines for the chart, as well as the X-axis labels.

argument.name: table
argument.doc: the data table to use for the chart

method.name: setDataViewDefinition
method.doc: Sets the data view definition to use for the chart.

argument.name: dataViewDefinition
argument.doc: a data view definition object that defines the view that should be derived from the given data source for the chart drawing

method.name: setDimensions
method.doc: Sets the dimensions for the chart.

argument.name: width
argument.doc: the width of the chart, in pixels

argument.name: height
argument.doc: the height of the chart, in pixels

method.name: setLegendPosition
method.doc: Sets the position of the legend with respect to the chart.

argument.name: position
argument.doc: the position of the legend

method.name: setLegendTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the text style of the chart legend.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the chart legend.

method.name: setOption
method.doc: Sets advanced options for this chart.

argument.name: option
argument.doc: the option to set

argument.name: value
argument.doc: the value to set

method.doc: Sets the range for the chart.

argument.name: start
argument.doc: value for the lowest grid line of the range axis

argument.name: end
argument.doc: value for the highest grid line of the range axis

method.name: setStacked
method.doc: Uses stacked lines, meaning that line and bar values are stacked (accumulated).

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the title of the chart.

argument.name: chartTitle
argument.doc: the chart title.

method.name: setTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the text style of the chart title.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the chart title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setXAxisTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the horizontal axis text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setXAxisTitle
method.doc: Adds a title to the horizontal axis.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title for the X-axis

method.name: setXAxisTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the horizontal axis title text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setYAxisTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the vertical axis text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setYAxisTitle
method.doc: Adds a title to the vertical axis.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title for the Y-axis

method.name: setYAxisTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the vertical axis title text style.

argument.name: textStyle

charts.CategoryFilterBuilder.name: CategoryFilterBuilder
charts.CategoryFilterBuilder.doc: A builder for category filter controls.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds a control.

method.name: setAllowMultiple
method.doc: Sets whether multiple values can be selected, rather than just one.

argument.name: allowMultiple
argument.doc: if false, the user will not be able to select multiple values

method.name: setAllowNone
method.doc: Sets whether the user is allowed not to choose any value.

argument.name: allowNone
argument.doc: if false, the user must choose at least one value

method.name: setAllowTyping
method.doc: Sets whether the user is allowed to type in a text field to narrow down the list of possible choices (via an autocompleter), or not.

argument.name: allowTyping
argument.doc: if false, the user will not be allowed to type in a text field to narrow down the list of possible choices

method.name: setCaption
method.doc: Sets the caption to display inside the value picker widget when no item is selected.

argument.name: caption
argument.doc: the caption to display inside the value picker widget when no item is selected

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table to use for the control using a DataTableBuilder.

argument.name: tableBuilder
argument.doc: a data table builder. A new data table will be created instantly as part of this call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the control.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the control data table, which will be the control's underlying data model.

argument.name: table
argument.doc: the data table to use for the control

method.name: setFilterColumnIndex
method.doc: Sets the index of the data table column to filter on.

argument.name: columnIndex
argument.doc: the index of the data table column the filter should operate upon

method.name: setFilterColumnLabel
method.doc: Sets the label of the data table column to filter on.

argument.name: columnLabel
argument.doc: the label of the column to filter on

method.name: setLabel
method.doc: Sets the label to display next to the slider.

argument.name: label
argument.doc: the label to display next to the slider

method.name: setLabelSeparator
method.doc: Sets a separator string appended to the label, to visually separate the label from the category picker.

argument.name: labelSeparator
argument.doc: the string to use to separate the label from the category picker

method.name: setLabelStacking
method.doc: Sets whether the label should display above (vertical stacking) or beside (horizontal stacking) the input field.

argument.name: orientation
argument.doc: the orientation of the stacking

method.name: setSelectedValuesLayout
method.doc: Sets how to display selected values, when multiple selection is allowed.

argument.name: layout
argument.doc: the layout in which to display the selected values

method.name: setSortValues
method.doc: Sets whether the values to choose from should be sorted.

argument.name: sortValues
argument.doc: if true, sorts the values displayed in the widget alphabetically

method.name: setValues
method.doc: Sets the list of values (categories) the user can choose from.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: list of values the user can choose from

charts.Chart.name: Chart
charts.Chart.doc: A Chart object, which can be embedded into documents, UI elements, or used as a static image. For charts embedded in spreadsheets, see EmbeddedChart.

method.name: getAs
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob converted to the specified content type.

argument.name: contentType
argument.doc: the MIME type to convert to. For most blobs, 'application/pdf' is the only valid option. For images in BMP, GIF, JPEG, or PNG format, any of 'image/bmp', 'image/gif', 'image/jpeg', or 'image/png' are also valid.

method.name: getBlob
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a blob.

method.name: getId
method.doc: Returns the id that has been assigned to this object.

method.name: getOptions
method.doc: Returns the options for this chart, such as height, colors, axes, etc.

method.name: getType
method.doc: Gets the type of this object.

method.name: setId
method.doc: Sets the id of this Chart to be used with UiApp.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the new id, which can be used to retrieve the Chart from app.getElementById(id).

charts.ChartOptions.name: ChartOptions
charts.ChartOptions.doc: Exposes options currently configured for a Chart, such as height, color, etc.

method.name: get
method.doc: Returns a configured option for this chart.

argument.name: option
argument.doc: string representing the desired option

charts.ColumnChartBuilder.name: ColumnChartBuilder
charts.ColumnChartBuilder.doc: Builder for column charts. For more details, see the Google Charts documentation.

method.doc: Sets the position of the legend with respect to the chart.

argument.name: position
argument.doc: the position of the legend

method.name: setLegendTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the text style of the chart legend.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the chart legend.

method.name: setOption
method.doc: Sets advanced options for this chart.

argument.name: option
argument.doc: the option to set

argument.name: value
argument.doc: the value to set

method.name: setRange
method.doc: Sets the range for the chart.

argument.name: start
argument.doc: value for the lowest grid line of the range axis

argument.name: end
argument.doc: value for the highest grid line of the range axis

method.name: setStacked
method.doc: Uses stacked lines, meaning that line and bar values are stacked (accumulated).

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the title of the chart.

argument.name: chartTitle
argument.doc: the chart title.

method.name: setTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the text style of the chart title.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the chart title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setXAxisTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the horizontal axis text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setXAxisTitle
method.doc: Adds a title to the horizontal axis.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title for the X-axis

method.name: setXAxisTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the horizontal axis title text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setYAxisTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the vertical axis text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setYAxisTitle
method.doc: Adds a title to the vertical axis.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title for the Y-axis

method.name: setYAxisTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the vertical axis title text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: useLogScale
method.doc: Makes the range axis into a logarithmic scale (requires all values to be positive).

charts.Control.name: Control
charts.Control.doc: A user interface control object, that drives the data displayed by a DashboardPanel.

method.name: getId
method.doc: Returns the id that has been assigned to this object.

method.name: getType
method.doc: Gets the type of this object.

method.name: setId
method.doc: Sets the id of this Control to be used with UiApp.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the new id, which can be used to retrieve the Control from app.getElementById(id).

charts.DashboardPanel.name: DashboardPanel
charts.DashboardPanel.doc: A dashboard is a visual structure that enables the organization and management of multiple charts that share the same underlying data.

method.name: getId
method.doc: Returns the id that has been assigned to this object.

method.name: getType
method.doc: Gets the type of this object.

method.name: setId
method.doc: Sets the id of this DashboardPanel to be used with UiApp.

argument.name: id
argument.doc: the new id, which can be used to retrieve the DashboardPanel from app.getElementById(id).

charts.DashboardPanelBuilder.name: DashboardPanelBuilder
charts.DashboardPanelBuilder.doc: A builder for a dashboard panel object. For an example of how to use DashboardPanelBuilder, refer to DashboardPanel.

method.name: bind
method.doc: Binds a control to a chart, so that the chart is redrawn whenever the control collects a user interaction that affects the data managed by the dashboard.

argument.name: control
argument.doc: a control to bind

argument.name: chart
argument.doc: a chart to bind

method.name: bind
method.doc: Binds multiple controls to multiple charts, so that the charts are redrawn whenever the controls collect a user interaction that affects the data managed by the dashboard.

argument.name: controls
argument.doc: an array of controls to bind

argument.name: charts
argument.doc: an array charts to bind

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds a dashboard.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table to use for the dashboard using a DataTableBuilder.

argument.name: tableBuilder
argument.doc: a data table builder. A new data table will be created instantly as part of this call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the dashboard.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the dashboard's data table, which will be the control's underlying data model.

argument.name: source
argument.doc: the data source to use for the dashboard

charts.DataTable.name: DataTable
charts.DataTable.doc: A Data Table to be used in charts. A DataTable can come from sources such as Google Sheets or specified data-table URLs, or can be filled in by hand. This class intentionally has no methods: a DataTable can be passed around, but not manipulated directly.

charts.DataTableBuilder.name: DataTableBuilder
charts.DataTableBuilder.doc: Builder of DataTable objects. Building a data table consists of first specifying its columns, and then adding its rows, one at a time. Example:

method.name: addColumn
method.doc: Adds a column to the data table.

argument.name: type
argument.doc: type of data in the column (number, string, or date)

argument.name: label
argument.doc: label of the column (it's used for chart legends).

method.name: addRow
method.doc: Adds a row to the data table.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: values for the row, specified in the same order that the columns are entered.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds and returns a data table.

method.name: setValue
method.doc: Sets a specific value in the table.

argument.name: row
argument.doc: the row index (the first row has index 0)

argument.name: column
argument.doc: the column index (the first column has index 0)

argument.name: value
argument.doc: the value of the table cell (should have the right type for the column).

charts.DataViewDefinition.name: DataViewDefinition
charts.DataViewDefinition.doc: A data view definition for visualizing chart data.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds and returns the data view definition object that was built using this builder.

method.name: setColumns
method.doc: Sets the indexes of the columns to include in the data view as well as specifying role-column information.

argument.name: columns
argument.doc: an array of column indexes, or column descriptions (an object), to include in the data view. The column descriptions define a column role. The data table and the enumeration for data view columns are zero-based.

charts.LineChartBuilder.name: LineChartBuilder
charts.LineChartBuilder.doc: Builder for line charts. For more details, see the Google Charts documentation.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setYAxisTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the vertical axis text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: setYAxisTitle
method.doc: Adds a title to the vertical axis.

argument.name: title
argument.doc: the title for the Y-axis

method.name: setYAxisTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the vertical axis title text style.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the horizontal axis title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

method.name: useLogScale
method.doc: Makes the range axis into a logarithmic scale (requires all values to be positive).

charts.NumberRangeFilterBuilder.name: NumberRangeFilterBuilder
charts.NumberRangeFilterBuilder.doc: A builder for number range filter controls.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds a control.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table to use for the control using a DataTableBuilder.

argument.name: tableBuilder
argument.doc: a data table builder. A new data table will be created instantly as part of this call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the control.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the control data table, which will be the control's underlying data model.

argument.name: table
argument.doc: the data table to use for the control

method.name: setFilterColumnIndex
method.doc: Sets the index of the data table column to filter on.

argument.name: columnIndex
argument.doc: the index of the data table column the filter should operate upon

method.name: setFilterColumnLabel
method.doc: Sets the label of the data table column to filter on.

argument.name: columnLabel
argument.doc: the label of the column to filter on

method.name: setLabel
method.doc: Sets the label to display next to the slider.

argument.name: label
argument.doc: the label to display next to the slider

method.name: setLabelSeparator
method.doc: Sets a separator string appended to the label, to visually separate the label from the category picker.

argument.name: labelSeparator
argument.doc: the string to use to separate the label from the category picker

method.name: setLabelStacking
method.doc: Sets whether the label should display above (vertical stacking) or beside (horizontal stacking) the input field.

argument.name: orientation
argument.doc: the orientation of the stacking

method.name: setMaxValue
method.doc: Sets the maximum allowed value for the range lower extent.

argument.name: maxValue
argument.doc: the maximum value of the slider

method.name: setMinValue
method.doc: Sets the minimum allowed value for the range lower extent.

argument.name: minValue
argument.doc: the minimum value of the slider

method.name: setOrientation
method.doc: Sets the slider orientation.

argument.name: orientation
argument.doc: the slider orientation

method.name: setShowRangeValues
method.doc: Sets whether to have labels next to the slider displaying extents of the selected range.

argument.name: showRangeValues
argument.doc: if true, enables showing of labels next to the slider

method.name: setTicks
method.doc: Sets the number of ticks (fixed positions in a range bar) a number range filter slider thumbs can fall in.

argument.name: ticks
argument.doc: the number of ticks on the slider

charts.PieChartBuilder.name: PieChartBuilder
charts.PieChartBuilder.doc: A builder for pie charts. For more details, see the Google Charts documentation.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds the chart.

method.name: reverseCategories
method.doc: Reverses the drawing of series in the domain axis.

method.name: set3D
method.doc: Sets the chart to be three-dimensional.

method.name: setBackgroundColor
method.doc: Sets the background color for the chart.

argument.name: cssValue
argument.doc: the CSS value for the color (such as "blue" or "#00f")

method.name: setColors
method.doc: Sets the colors for the lines in the chart.

argument.name: cssValues
argument.doc: an array of color CSS values, such as ["red", "#acf"]. The nth element in the array represents the color of the nth line in the chart.

method.name: setDataSourceUrl
method.doc: Sets the data source URL that will be used to pull data in from an external source, such as Google Sheets.

argument.name: url
argument.doc: the data source URL, including any query parameters

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table to use for the chart using a DataTableBuilder.

argument.name: tableBuilder
argument.doc: a data table builder. A new data table will be created instantly as part of this call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the chart.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table which contains the lines for the chart, as well as the X-axis labels.

argument.name: table
argument.doc: the data table to use for the chart

method.name: setDataViewDefinition
method.doc: Sets the data view definition to use for the chart.

argument.name: dataViewDefinition
argument.doc: a data view definition object that defines the view that should be derived from the given data source for the chart drawing

method.name: setDimensions
method.doc: Sets the dimensions for the chart.

argument.name: width
argument.doc: the width of the chart, in pixels

argument.name: height
argument.doc: the height of the chart, in pixels

method.name: setLegendPosition
method.doc: Sets the position of the legend with respect to the chart.

argument.name: position
argument.doc: the position of the legend

method.name: setLegendTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the text style of the chart legend.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the chart legend.

method.name: setOption
method.doc: Sets advanced options for this chart.

argument.name: option
argument.doc: the option to set

argument.name: value
argument.doc: the value to set

method.name: setTitle
method.doc: Sets the title of the chart.

argument.name: chartTitle
argument.doc: the chart title.

method.name: setTitleTextStyle
method.doc: Sets the text style of the chart title.

argument.name: textStyle
argument.doc: the text style to use for the chart title. TextStyleBuilder object can be created by calling Charts.newTextStyle().

charts.StringFilterBuilder.name: StringFilterBuilder
charts.StringFilterBuilder.doc: A builder for string filter controls.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds a control.

method.name: setCaseSensitive
method.doc: Sets whether matching should be case sensitive or not.

argument.name: caseSensitive
argument.doc: if true, enables string matching case sensitivity

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table to use for the control using a DataTableBuilder.

argument.name: tableBuilder
argument.doc: a data table builder. A new data table will be created instantly as part of this call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the control.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the control data table, which will be the control's underlying data model.

argument.name: table
argument.doc: the data table to use for the control

method.name: setFilterColumnIndex
method.doc: Sets the index of the data table column to filter on.

argument.name: columnIndex
argument.doc: the index of the data table column the filter should operate upon

method.name: setFilterColumnLabel
method.doc: Sets the label of the data table column to filter on.

argument.name: columnLabel
argument.doc: the label of the column to filter on

method.name: setLabel
method.doc: Sets the label to display next to the slider.

argument.name: label
argument.doc: the label to display next to the slider

method.name: setLabelSeparator
method.doc: Sets a separator string appended to the label, to visually separate the label from the category picker.

argument.name: labelSeparator
argument.doc: the string to use to separate the label from the category picker

method.name: setLabelStacking
method.doc: Sets whether the label should display above (vertical stacking) or beside (horizontal stacking) the input field.

argument.name: orientation
argument.doc: the orientation of the stacking

method.name: setMatchType
method.doc: Sets whether the control should match exact values only (MatchType.EXACT), prefixes starting from the beginning of the value (MatchType.PREFIX), or any substring (MatchType.ANY).

argument.name: matchType
argument.doc: the string matching type

method.name: setRealtimeTrigger
method.doc: Sets whether the control should match any time a key is pressed or only when the input field 'changes' (loss of focus or pressing the Enter key).

argument.name: realtimeTrigger
argument.doc: if true, sets events to be triggered at real time (when a key is pressed)

charts.TableChartBuilder.name: TableChartBuilder
charts.TableChartBuilder.doc: A builder for table charts. For more details, see the Google Charts documentation.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds the chart.

method.name: enablePaging
method.doc: Sets whether to enable paging through the data.

argument.name: enablePaging
argument.doc: true if paging should be enabled, false otherwise

method.name: enablePaging
method.doc: Enables paging and sets the number of rows in each page.

argument.name: pageSize
argument.doc: the number of rows in each page of the table

method.name: enablePaging
method.doc: Enables paging, sets the number of rows in each page and the first table page to display (page numbers are zero based).

argument.name: pageSize
argument.doc: the number of rows in each page of the table

argument.name: startPage
argument.doc: the first table page to display (page numbers are zero based)

method.name: enableRtlTable
method.doc: Adds basic support for right-to-left languages (such as Arabic or Hebrew) by reversing the column order of the table, so that column zero is the right-most column, and the last column is the left-most column.

argument.name: rtlEnabled
argument.doc: true if right-to-left support should be enabled, false otherwise

method.name: enableSorting
method.doc: Sets whether to sort columns when the user clicks a column heading.

argument.name: enableSorting
argument.doc: true if to enable sorting by clicking on column headers, false otherwise

method.name: setDataSourceUrl
method.doc: Sets the data source URL that will be used to pull data in from an external source, such as Google Sheets.

argument.name: url
argument.doc: the data source URL, including any query parameters

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table to use for the chart using a DataTableBuilder.

argument.name: tableBuilder
argument.doc: a data table builder. A new data table will be created instantly as part of this call, so any further updates to the builder won't be reflected in the chart.

method.name: setDataTable
method.doc: Sets the data table which contains the lines for the chart, as well as the X-axis labels.

argument.name: table
argument.doc: the data table to use for the chart

method.name: setDataViewDefinition
method.doc: Sets the data view definition to use for the chart.

argument.name: dataViewDefinition
argument.doc: a data view definition object that defines the view that should be derived from the given data source for the chart drawing

method.name: setDimensions
method.doc: Sets the dimensions for the chart.

argument.name: width
argument.doc: the width of the chart, in pixels

argument.name: height
argument.doc: the height of the chart, in pixels

method.name: setFirstRowNumber
method.doc: Sets the row number for the first row in the data table.

argument.name: number
argument.doc: the row number for the first row in the data table

method.name: setInitialSortingAscending
method.doc: Sets the index of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted (ascending).

argument.name: column
argument.doc: the number of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted

method.name: setInitialSortingDescending
method.doc: Sets the index of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted (descending).

argument.name: column
argument.doc: the number of the column according to which the table should be initially sorted

method.name: setOption
method.doc: Sets advanced options for this chart.

argument.name: option
argument.doc: the option to set

argument.name: value
argument.doc: the value to set

method.name: showRowNumberColumn
method.doc: Sets whether to show the row number as the first column of the table.

argument.name: showRowNumber
argument.doc: true if the first column of the table should show the row number, false otherwise

method.name: useAlternatingRowStyle
method.doc: Sets whether alternating color style will be assigned to odd and even rows of a table chart.

argument.name: alternate
argument.doc: true if color styles should be alternating, false otherwise

charts.TextStyle.name: TextStyle
charts.TextStyle.doc: A text style configuration object. Used in charts options to configure text style for elements that accepts it, such as title, horizontal axis, vertical axis, legend and tooltip.

method.name: getColor
method.doc: Gets the color of the text style.

method.name: getFontName
method.doc: Gets the font name of the text style.

method.name: getFontSize
method.doc: Gets the font size of the text style.

charts.TextStyleBuilder.name: TextStyleBuilder
charts.TextStyleBuilder.doc: A builder used to create TextStyle objects. It allows configuration of the text's properties such as name, color, and size.

method.name: build
method.doc: Builds and returns a text style configuration object that was built using this builder.

method.name: setColor
method.doc: Sets the color of the text style.

argument.name: cssValue
argument.doc: the CSS value for the color (such as "blue" or "#00f").

method.name: setFontName
method.doc: Sets the font name of the text style

argument.name: fontName
argument.doc: the font name to use for the text style

method.name: setFontSize
method.doc: Sets the font size of the text style.

argument.name: fontSize
argument.doc: the font size in pixels to use for the text style

charts.DataTableSource.name: DataTableSource
charts.DataTableSource.doc: Interface for objects that can represent their data as a DataTable.

method.name: getDataTable
method.doc: Return the data inside this object as a DataTable.

charts.ChartHiddenDimensionStrategy.name: ChartHiddenDimensionStrategy
charts.ChartHiddenDimensionStrategy.doc: An enumeration of how hidden dimensions in a source are expressed in a chart.

property.name: IGNORE_BOTH
property.doc: Default; charts skips any hidden columns and hidden rows.

property.name: SHOW_BOTH
property.doc: Charts does not skip hidden columns or hidden rows.

charts.ChartMergeStrategy.name: ChartMergeStrategy
charts.ChartMergeStrategy.doc: An enumeration of how multiple ranges in the source are expressed in a chart.

property.name: MERGE_COLUMNS
property.doc: Default. Charts merges the columns of multiple ranges.

property.name: MERGE_ROWS
property.doc: Charts merges the rows of multiple ranges.

charts.ChartType.name: ChartType
charts.ChartType.doc: Chart types supported by the Charts service.

charts.ColumnType.name: ColumnType
charts.ColumnType.doc: An enumeration of the valid data types for columns in a DataTable.

charts.CurveStyle.name: CurveStyle
charts.CurveStyle.doc: An enumeration of the styles for curves in a chart.

property.name: SMOOTH
property.doc: The angles of the line will be smoothed

charts.MatchType.name: MatchType
charts.MatchType.doc: An enumeration of how a string value should be matched. Matching a string is a boolean operation. Given a string, a match term (string), and a match type, the operation will output true in the following cases:

property.name: PREFIX
property.doc: Match prefixes starting from the beginning of the value

method.name: getName
method.doc: Returns the name of the MatchType to be used in the options JSON.

charts.Orientation.name: Orientation
charts.Orientation.doc: An enumeration of the orientation of an object.

charts.PickerValuesLayout.name: PickerValuesLayout
charts.PickerValuesLayout.doc: An enumeration of how to display selected values in picker widget.

property.name: ASIDE
property.doc: Selected values will display in a single text line next to the value picker widget

property.name: BELOW
property.doc: Selected values will display in a single text line below the widget

property.name: BELOW_WRAPPING
property.doc: Similar to below, but entries that cannot fit in the picker will wrap to a new line

property.name: BELOW_STACKED
property.doc: Selected values will be displayed in a column below the widget

charts.PointStyle.name: PointStyle
charts.PointStyle.doc: An enumeration of the styles of points in a line.

charts.Position.name: Position
charts.Position.doc: An enumeration of legend positions within a chart.

property.name: RIGHT
property.doc: To the right of the chart.
